You are correct. "Black man" can be translated as both 黒人 (こくじん) and 黒人 (くろびと) in Japanese. Both translations are commonly used, but こくじん is more often used in modern contexts to refer to a person with black ethnicity, while くろびと has a more traditional connotation and can also refer to a person with black (or dark) skin.
